title: San Rafael Contra Dance
description:
North Bay Contra Dance
Contra Dance is fun, quick to learn, and great exercise. Every dance night has a live band, caller, and a quick start class for first timers.
In contra dance, you will dance with your partner but also with other couples as you progress down the line. The figures for each dance are done in a repeated sequence after a brief walk through by the caller. Each dance may last 10 ‚Äì 12 minutes and then we encourage you to switch partners as the night goes on.
What to wear: Comfortable shoes that will enable you to pivot and slide on the wood floor.
When to arrive: If this is your first time, come 30 minutes early to check in, join the quick start class, and get you ready for the first dance.
How hard to learn? Most newcomers will find that they can get dancing right away as the figures are quite simple.
Come as a group, couple, or single! Our dance is inclusive to all ages and genders.
Cost: *Free to first-time dancers*. $13 members, $15 non-members, $8 student or limited income.

Source: Meetup Contra Dance

title: Jim Kweskin
location: Mercury Theater, 3333 Petaluma Blvd N, Petaluma, CA 94952
description:
Jim Kweskin with Suzy Thompson and Matthew Berlin Saturday February 14 at 7:30pm A night of folk music with Jim Kweskin, featuring Suzy Thompson on fiddle & Matt Berlin on bass. Kweskin is the founder of the legendary 1960s Jim Kweskin Jug Band with Fritz Richmond, Geoff Muldaur, Maria Muldaur, Mel Lyman and Bruno Wolfe. During the five years they were together, they successfully transformed the sounds of pre-World War II rural music into a springboard for their good-humored performances. Their imitators were legion, including a San Francisco jug band that became the Grateful Dead, a Los Angeles jug band that became the Nitty Gritty Dirt Band, and a New York jug band that became the Lovin' Spoonful. No other group attained their unique blend of youthful energy and antiquarian expertise, tight musicianship, loose camaraderie, and infectious swing. These days Jim is best known as a singer and bandleader, but he also created one of the bedrock guitar styles of the folk revival, adapting the ragtime-blues fingerpicking of artists like Mississippi John Hurt and Pink Anderson to the more complex chords of pop and jazz. He has maintained a remarkably consistent musical vision since his jug band days, continuing to explore traditional folk and blues with the sophisticated sensibility of a jazz musician, and jazz with the communal simplicity of a folk artist. He has recorded many solo ventures, as a member of the U and I band, with band-mate Geoff Muldaur, with Samoa Wilson, with The Texas Sheiks as well as performing and recording with a wide variety of well-known musicians such as Maria Muldaur, John Sebastian, David Grisman, Cindy Cashdollar, Happy Traum, Meredith Axelrod, Juli Crockett and Samoa Wilson, to name a few.

Source: Mercury Theater

title: Mindfulness Sunday Meditation: Cultivating Consciousness
description:
Meditate with a Monk in Sonoma County
Join us for a transformative workshop on mindfulness meditation and cultivating consciousness. Dive deep into the teachings of Theravada Buddhism, focusing on insight meditation to develop a clear understanding of the nature of the mind and consciousness. This workshop will include guided meditation sessions to help you strengthen your meditation practice and cultivate mindfulness in your daily life. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced meditator, this workshop offers a welcoming space to explore the depths of your own consciousness and enhance your spiritual journey. Come together with like-minded individuals to deepen your practice and connect with the wisdom of Theravada Buddhism, and provide an opportunity to deepen mindfulness, wisdom, and inner stillness.
Our sessions are led by Bhikkhunis closely associated with our Dhammadharini Sangha. Check out the [recording from the past event](https://youtube.com/live/s07U2kzWoWk?feature=share) on our YouTube channel.
You‚Äôre also welcome to join us in person at Dhammadharini Monastery, in the peaceful setting of our outdoor Dana Sala Pavilion
Register for this event on Dhammadharini's website to receive the address:
[https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2](https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2)
Check out the sangha website at
[https://www.dhammadharini.net](https://www.dhammadharini.net/)

title: Botanical Ink Making
location: 230 Lakeville Street, Petaluma, CA  94952
description:
[ { "type": "highlight", "id": "b4413bba-8068-4825-bc86-e6a2c46bbe60", "shape": "underline", "isFront": false, "isAnimationEnabled": false, "animation": "draw", "duration": 0.5, "direction": "right", "color": { "type": "THEME_COLOR" }, "thickness": { "unit": "em", "value": 0.1 }, "linecap": "square" } ] Botanical Ink Making: Colors that Tell a Story of Place, with Eames Ranch Studios Artist Resident Lena Wolff As part of Petaluma Arts Center's exhibition "Crafting Curiosity: Advancing a Legacy of Agriculture and Making at the Eames Ranch," Bay Area artist and craftswoman Lena Wolf leads a workshop exploring natural ink and paint making. Uniquely different from working with stable store-bought art materials, making handmade color is dynamic and surprising, offering an environmentally sound approach to artmaking while also forming a deeper connection to place. During the class, Lena will share about her experience generating colors with plants and fungi during her residency at the Eames Ranch and relay the fundamentals of the process: from foraging and gathering, to extracting color into paint. Participants will create several color charts as well as learn how to adjust hues with a variety of additives, documenting the process along the way and taking recipes home for future experimentation. As a longtime teacher of color theory, Lena will weave broader context into the workshop, sharing a brief history of paint-making and the phenomenon behind our perception of colors in interaction, looking at the subject through multiple lenses of art, craft, science, design and environmentalism. All materials will be supplied and are included in the workshop fee. THIS WORKSHOP IS SOLD OUT Please note that photography and video recording may take place during this event. By participating, you grant the Eames Institute permission to use your image for storytelling, marketing, and/or documentation purposes. By registering for this event, you also agree to receive occasional email communications from the Eames Institute of Infinite Curiosity. You may unsubscribe at any time. Please reach out to events@eamesinstitute.org with any questions. ‚Äî The Eames Institute of Infinite Curiosity is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit public charity dedicated to advancing the legacy of 20th-century designers Ray and Charles Eames. Over the course of their decades-long partnership, the husband and wife duo approached design as a tool for problem-solving and discovery‚Äîdriven by curiosity, refined through iteration, and always guided by purpose. Their work was wide-ranging, spanning furniture, architecture, film, exhibition design and more, with every project grounded in rigor, joy, and a meticulous commitment to make things better. 

Source: Petaluma Arts Center

title: Olompali State Historic Park - Exploratory Hike
description:
Mindfull Hikes
***Please be in good enough shape to hike at a moderate/fast steady pace (+/-2.5 mph) and comfortable with elevation changes.***

The park overlooks the Petaluma River and San Pablo Bay from the east-facing slopes of 1,558 foot Mount Burdell. The name "olompali" comes from the Miwok language and may be translated as "southern village" or "southern people." The Coast Miwok inhabited at least one site within the area of the present-day park continuously from as early as 6,000 BC, until the early 1850s.

**Distance:** +/- 9 miles total; out and back

**The hike:**
Exploratory because I've not led this hike and it has been many years since I hiked it. We'll start off on the Miwok Trail to Burdell Trail to the turn around point. At the peak of Mt Burdell we'll head back the way we came on Burdell Trail and then talke the Miwok loop trail to the starting place.

**Where to meet:** Parking lot of the park

**Directions:**
The park is accessible from both the Northbound and Southbound lanes of Highway 101. Exit at Atherton Ave./San Marin Dr. and follow posted directional signs to the park.

*Please be on time. We‚Äôll start promptly at the start time listed.* ***Give yourself a little extra time to arrive*** and get situated so that you‚Äôre part of the opening circle as this is an essential part of our time together.

**Parking:**
Free if you have a CA State Park pass.
OR $10, payable by cash, check, or via smartphone with QR code at the parking lot. If paying by cash, look for the yellow fee payment tube at the west end of the parking lot to deposit your payment.

**Restroom**: Near the parking area

**What to bring:** Lunch, water, hat, good hiking shoes, a joyful spirit and laughter. Please dress appropriately for the weather that day. Layers of clothing are always advisable.
**===================================**
**Reminders:**
Mindful hikes are intended to be a way to connect more fully with ourselves, each other and with the land. There will be two periods of silent walking throughout the hike to allow the senses to be fully alive and felt. There will also be time during the hike to visit and connect with each other. These times of talking and connecting are an invitation to bring mindfulness to the present moment. **It's a time to put away the cell phone and cameras to disengage from technology to be fully present with each other, our *senses and the land we are inhabiting.***

***If you're on the waitlist for the hike and want to attend please message Vickie a few days before the scheduled hike. Most hikes have people drop off at the last minute and it's possible there is an opening.***

**DƒÅna**
In the spirit of the Buddhist tradition mindful hikes are offered as a dƒÅna based event. Rick Hansen says ‚Äúgenerosity is a beautiful practice that opens and gladdens the heart, relaxes the contraction of ‚Äòself‚Äô and ripples out into the world to touch many people.‚Äù The dƒÅna practice is **heart centered** and in the spirit of generosity. Venmo or cash is graciously accepted. Venmo account is: @vickieix8; last four digits 4714 of my phone # if asked.

**No-Show Policy:** Please cancel at least 24 hours before the start of the hike. Be mindful that there may be a waitlist. If your plans change and you're not coming, opening up a spot 4-5 days before the hike it's more likely someone will be able to attend than if you cancel at the last minute. You're considered a no-show if you cancel at the last minute. Members with 2 no-shows are removed from the group.

Source: Meetup Mindfull Hikes

title: Tuesday Night Fitness Hike: 5+ Fast Miles, Downtown Petaluma and Western Hills
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
WARNING: THE TUESDAY NIGHT FITNESS HIKE IS AN AEROBIC, FAST-PACED URBAN HIKE! WE TARGET A PACE OF 16-MINUTES PER MILE WITH ONLY BRIEF STOPS (TO REGROUP AS NEEDED). OUR SUMMER ROUTE INCLUDES THE HILLS IN HELEN PUTNAM PARK (740 FT. ELEVATION GAIN), AND OUR WINTER ROUTE EXPLORES THE WATER TANKS (690 FT. ELEVATION GAIN). IF YOU FIND YOU ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY KEEPING UP WITH THE LEADERS IN THIS GROUP, PLEASE USE THE OPT-OUT POINT AT THE FIRST MILE OF THE HIKE! ANOTHER OPTION IS OUR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WALK FOR A MORE MODERATE PACE. THANK YOU FOR HELPING ME KEEP THIS HIKE AN AEROBIC WORKOUT!

NOTE:
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is posted on the SCO Calendar every week. Steve Tubbs is shown as the host each week but he might, or might not, show up to the event. This is, more often than not, a small group of regular, fit walkers who show up on time every Tuesday night to enjoy this rigorous walk. We leave promptly at 6:10 pm from the Kentucky Street entrance to the LanMart Building. So, if you don't see Steve on the Tuesday night you are there, you might see him on the next one.

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike, 5+ miles fast paced urban hike:

This Fitness Hike includes multiple steep uphill portions in Helen Putnam Park (during Daylight Savings Time), and at the Petaluma Water Tanks (after Daylight Savings Time ends).

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike:

* Warning! This is a FAST hike... a real workout!
* 5+ miles
* Meetup time 6:00 pm (We hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Difficulty is STRENUOUS!
* 90 minutes

This is a fast, evening Fitness Hike that starts downtown outside (on the sidewalk) of the LanMart Building (Brixx Restaurant, Heebe Jeebe) on Kentucky Street. We head west to Helen Putnam Park (or the Petaluma Water Tanks when DST ends) for some beautiful vistas before returning to our starting point on Kentucky Street. This hike is generally the same route and is focused primarily on fitness.

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking/hiking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

WHAT ABOUT THE DARKNESS?
Bring a SMALL flashlight. The sidewalks can be treacherous in west Petaluma, and you'll want to see those crags, cracks and upheavals in the concrete. Reflective clothing is also recommended so that vehicles can see you!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 mph (22 - 23 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike nearly 3.5 - 4.0 mph (we target a 16 minute mile, with multiple hills!)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?

Please take the time to RSVP YES when you plan on attending an event. It is equally important to keep your RSVP up to date. If you've RSVP'd YES for an event, we are going to wait for you until the departure time. We leave promptly at 6:10 PM, so if you arrive late you can join us along the route. We typically hike the same route for each hike, and our focus is on aerobic exercise.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

SCO Organizers

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

title: Mindfulness Tuesday Meditation: Cultivating Consciousness
description:
Meditate with a Monk in Sonoma County
Join us for a transformative workshop on mindfulness meditation and cultivating consciousness. Dive deep into the teachings of Theravada Buddhism, focusing on insight meditation to develop a clear understanding of the nature of the mind and consciousness. This workshop will include guided meditation sessions to help you strengthen your meditation practice and cultivate mindfulness in your daily life. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced meditator, this workshop offers a welcoming space to explore the depths of your own consciousness and enhance your spiritual journey. Come together with like-minded individuals to deepen your practice and connect with the wisdom of Theravada Buddhism.
Our sessions are led by Bhikkhunis closely associated with our Dhammadharini Sangha. Check out Dhammadharini Sangha at [https://www.dhammadharini.net/](https://www.dhammadharini.net/)

title: Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown & Riverfront
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown and Riverfront

* Want to walk for fitness and exercise?
* New to walking and want to build up stamina?
* Like a slower pace than our Tuesday Night Fitness Hike?
* Would walking with a committed group of walkers help you?

If you said yes to any of these, then the Wednesday Night Walk in Petaluma is for you. We start at Aqus Cafe and take in the West Side of town, including some of Downtown, the Waterfront and a few of the Historic home of old Petaluma. We walk about 3-1/2 to 4-1/2 miles depending on weather conditions and the pace of the group that night.

Afterward if you have the time, join us at Aqus Cafe for a bite to eat and some liquid refreshment before heading home. Aqus Cafe is a true gem of a gathering place, restaurant, coffee house, and live music venue. But it's the people on either side of the counter that make this place so special.

DETAILS:

* Meetup time: 6:00pm (we hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Meetup location: Aqus Cafe
* Distance: 3.5 to 4-1/2 miles
* Duration: 75-80 minutes
* Pace: Easy/Moderate (about 2.5-3 mph or 20-24 minute miles)
* Difficulty: Easy (if you've walked 3-4 miles recently)
* Hills: Mostly flat with a few small and easy to climb hills
* Optional After-Hike Gathering at Aqus Cafe

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 - 3 mph (20-24 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is about 3.5-4 mph (15-17 minute miles)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks. You will not be spammed. If you are, let me know. Spamming will not be tolerated.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?
It's important to RSVP for these walks. When all the people have arrived for a walk that have RSVP'd, we leave... it might mean we leave early. If you didn't RSVP we are not going to wait for you. Plus, it's just a nice courtesy to the organizer and other participants. Please take the time to RSVP.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

Gary
SCO Organizer

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

title: Tomales Point Trail - Pt Reyes
description:
Mindfull Hikes
***Please be in good enough shape to hike at a moderate/fast steady pace (+/-2.5 mph) and comfortable with elevation changes.***

**The hike:** Join me for a hike at Tomales Point, the northern end of Point Reyes National Seashore. The Tomales Point Trail is popular for viewing Tule elk, birds and wildflowers in season. The out and back hike leads along the ridge crest of a narrow peninsula, offering spectacular views of Tomales Bay and Bolinas Ridge to the east, Bodega Bay to the north, and the coastline of the Point Reyes peninsula stretching to the south - when it's not fogged in.

**Trail:** Tomales Point Trail
**Distance:** +/- 9.5 miles round trip

**How to get there:**
From Petaluma take D Street/ turns into Pt Reyes Petaluma Rd. At Pt Reyes Station turn right Immediately after crossing the bridge on to Sir Francis Drake Blvd. After passing thru Inverness **\*Pay Attention\*** and turn right on Pierce Point Road. Travel past Abbotts Lagoon and Kehoe Beach. Keep going until you reach Pierce Point Ranch.

**Parking:** Free at Pierce Point Ranch

Closest restroom is at McClure's Beach .4 miles before the trailhead.

*Please be on time. We‚Äôll start promptly at the start time listed.* Give yourself a little extra time to arrive and get situated so that you‚Äôre part of the opening circle as this is an essential part of our time together.

**What to bring:** Lunch, water, hat, good hiking shoes, a joyful spirit and laughter. Please dress appropriately for the weather that day. Layers of clothing are always advisable.
**===================================**
**Reminders:**
Mindful hikes are intended to be a way to connect more fully with ourselves, each other and with the land. There will be two periods of silent walking throughout the hike to allow the senses to be fully alive and felt. There will also be time during the hike to visit and connect with each other. These times of talking and connecting are an invitation to bring mindfulness to the present moment. **It's a time to put away the cell phone and cameras to disengage from technology to be fully present with each other, our *senses and the land we are inhabiting.***

***If you're on the waitlist for the hike and want to attend please message Vickie a few days before the scheduled hike. Most hikes have people drop off at the last minute and it's possible there is an opening.***

**DƒÅna**
In the spirit of the Buddhist tradition mindful hikes are offered as a dƒÅna based event. Rick Hansen says ‚Äúgenerosity is a beautiful practice that opens and gladdens the heart, relaxes the contraction of ‚Äòself‚Äô and ripples out into the world to touch many people.‚Äù The dƒÅna practice is **heart centered** and in the spirit of generosity. Venmo or cash is graciously accepted. Venmo account is: @vickieix8; last four digits 4714 of my phone # if asked.

**No-Show Policy:** Please cancel at least 24 hours before the start of the hike. Be mindful that there may be a waitlist. If your plans change and you're not coming, opening up a spot 4-5 days before the hike it's more likely someone will be able to attend than if you cancel at the last minute. You're considered a no-show if you cancel at the last minute. Members with 2 no-shows are removed from the group.

Source: Meetup Mindfull Hikes

title: Santa Rosa Contra Dance
description:
North Bay Contra Dance
Contra Dance is fun, quick to learn, and great exercise. Every dance night has a live band, caller, and a quick start class for first timers.
In contra dance, you will dance with your partner but also with other couples as you progress down the line. The figures for each dance are done in a repeated sequence after a brief walk through by the caller. Each dance may last 10 ‚Äì 12 minutes and then we encourage you to switch partners as the night goes on.
What to wear: Comfortable shoes that will enable you to pivot and slide on the wood floor.
When to arrive: If this is your first time, come 30 minutes early to check in, join the quick start class, and get you ready for the first dance.
How hard to learn? Most newcomers will find that they can get dancing right away as the figures are quite simple.
Come as a group, couple, or single! Our dance is inclusive to all ages and genders.
Cost: *Free to first-time dancers*. $13 members, $15 non-members, $8 student or limited income.

Source: Meetup Contra Dance

title: Lake Sonoma Hike
description:
Go Wild Hikers
Wildflowers are early this year, and I have already seen some Orchids. Join me in search of early wildflowers at Lake Sonoma. We'll hike through a magical madrone forest, take in beautiful expansive views of the Mayacamas Mountain range as well as the Dry Creek and Warm Springs arms of Lake Sonoma. We will visit some of the largest manzanita and madrone trees I've seen. Best for individuals and dogs with at least a moderate level of fitness.

**Where We Meet/Important Directions**
Little Flat Parking (A large gravel parking lot)
From Hwy 101 take Dry Creek Road west towards Lake Sonoma. Go up the hill and across the bridge over the lake. Pay Attention, it's the first right turn into "Little Flat" parking lot.
Give yourself plenty of time to arrive. It's often farther than you think.

**Group Hike #333**
Dry Creek, No Name, North Slope and Bummer trails - a loop hike
Length - +/-5 miles/8 kilometers
Elevation change - +/-900 feet/274 meters
Difficulty - 7+ out of 10 some short steep rocky sections
Must be sure footed (confident and competent)!
Exposures - +/-30 % sun/70% shade - creek crossings, rocky, muddy, poison oak, ticks/insects.
Bring plenty of water. At least 68 oz./2 liters!
Dogs - Yes, must be healthy, well behaved and on a leash.
Facilities at trail head - None - Port O Potti about 1.5 miles in.
Cost - $5 cash
Parking -$7-day pass can be purchased on-site using a credit card through the Recreation.gov mobile app. Once on-site, follow the posted Scan & Pay instructions. You will need to download the free Recreation.gov mobile app prior to your arrival as some remote areas have limited or no cellular service. For more information about paying on-site, click here: [How Do I Use a Scan & Pay QR Code to Purchase an Activity Pass?](https://recreationonestoptest.servicenowservices.com/external?id=kb_article&sys_id=2011ea4a1b84bcd076c1dbdbe54bcb1d)
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring plenty of water for your dog too, a hat, snack, layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course, we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**After Hike Gathering?**
Quail & Condor
Bakery and Caf√©
44 Mill St Unit J
Healdsburg, CA 95448
[https://www.quailandcondor.com/](https://www.quailandcondor.com/)
(707) 473-8254
Outstanding new location with plenty of parking and a beautiful cafe. Behind the Parish Caf√© at the roundabout.

**When We Meet**
Sunday February 22, 2026
9:00 am - 12:00 pm
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP.
Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or any other contagion!
Hike may be changed, rescheduled or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

**Notice to New Hikers Only**
**"When a New Hiker (never hiked with me before) doesn't show up (No Show) to their first hike with the group, they will be removed (not banned) from the group immediately."**

Source: Meetup: Go Wild Hikers

title: Join us for Guided Buddhist Meditation and time for questions
description:

New and experienced meditators are welcome. We will start with direct guidance to begin the practice and allow time to experience the silence of meditation on your own. There will be time at the end for your questions regarding meditation practice.

You may stay on for a potluck meal at 11:00 am. Welcome to bring a dish to share.

This is followed by Sutta Study program from 1:00 to 2:30 pm.

We meet outdoors in the Dhammadharini Monastery Garden in the Sala Pavillion, as long as conducive weather lasts.

Come in person, or register at [here](https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2) to attend online

title: Mindfulness Sunday Meditation: Cultivating Consciousness
description:
Meditate with a Monk in Sonoma County
Join us for a transformative workshop on mindfulness meditation and cultivating consciousness. Dive deep into the teachings of Theravada Buddhism, focusing on insight meditation to develop a clear understanding of the nature of the mind and consciousness. This workshop will include guided meditation sessions to help you strengthen your meditation practice and cultivate mindfulness in your daily life. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced meditator, this workshop offers a welcoming space to explore the depths of your own consciousness and enhance your spiritual journey. Come together with like-minded individuals to deepen your practice and connect with the wisdom of Theravada Buddhism, and provide an opportunity to deepen mindfulness, wisdom, and inner stillness.
Our sessions are led by Bhikkhunis closely associated with our Dhammadharini Sangha. Check out the [recording from the past event](https://youtube.com/live/s07U2kzWoWk?feature=share) on our YouTube channel.
You‚Äôre also welcome to join us in person at Dhammadharini Monastery, in the peaceful setting of our outdoor Dana Sala Pavilion
Register for this event on Dhammadharini's website to receive the address:
[https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2](https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2)
Check out the sangha website at
[https://www.dhammadharini.net](https://www.dhammadharini.net/)

title: English Country Dance Napa
description:
North Bay Contra Dance
English country dancing is done in long lines (like contra), circles, or in geometric sets (squares, triangles). Like our contra dances, there is live music and a caller. You can come by yourself or with friends, since we change partners after each dance. If you‚Äôve ever done contra or square dancing, much of our dance vocabulary will be familiar to you since both of those styles evolved from English country dancing.

The dance is held the 1st and 3rd Sundays of each month, 2-4:30 pm, to live music, all levels of experience welcome; and occasional 5th Sundays for Advanced dancers. Admission is $15 for members of NBCDS and its affiliates, $8 for young adults ages 19-30, and $3 for youth ages 6 ‚Äì 18.

title: Tuesday Night Fitness Hike: 5+ Fast Miles, Downtown Petaluma and Western Hills
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
WARNING: THE TUESDAY NIGHT FITNESS HIKE IS AN AEROBIC, FAST-PACED URBAN HIKE! WE TARGET A PACE OF 16-MINUTES PER MILE WITH ONLY BRIEF STOPS (TO REGROUP AS NEEDED). OUR SUMMER ROUTE INCLUDES THE HILLS IN HELEN PUTNAM PARK (740 FT. ELEVATION GAIN), AND OUR WINTER ROUTE EXPLORES THE WATER TANKS (690 FT. ELEVATION GAIN). IF YOU FIND YOU ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY KEEPING UP WITH THE LEADERS IN THIS GROUP, PLEASE USE THE OPT-OUT POINT AT THE FIRST MILE OF THE HIKE! ANOTHER OPTION IS OUR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WALK FOR A MORE MODERATE PACE. THANK YOU FOR HELPING ME KEEP THIS HIKE AN AEROBIC WORKOUT!

NOTE:
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is posted on the SCO Calendar every week. Steve Tubbs is shown as the host each week but he might, or might not, show up to the event. This is, more often than not, a small group of regular, fit walkers who show up on time every Tuesday night to enjoy this rigorous walk. We leave promptly at 6:10 pm from the Kentucky Street entrance to the LanMart Building. So, if you don't see Steve on the Tuesday night you are there, you might see him on the next one.

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike, 5+ miles fast paced urban hike:

This Fitness Hike includes multiple steep uphill portions in Helen Putnam Park (during Daylight Savings Time), and at the Petaluma Water Tanks (after Daylight Savings Time ends).

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike:

* Warning! This is a FAST hike... a real workout!
* 5+ miles
* Meetup time 6:00 pm (We hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Difficulty is STRENUOUS!
* 90 minutes

This is a fast, evening Fitness Hike that starts downtown outside (on the sidewalk) of the LanMart Building (Brixx Restaurant, Heebe Jeebe) on Kentucky Street. We head west to Helen Putnam Park (or the Petaluma Water Tanks when DST ends) for some beautiful vistas before returning to our starting point on Kentucky Street. This hike is generally the same route and is focused primarily on fitness.

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking/hiking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

WHAT ABOUT THE DARKNESS?
Bring a SMALL flashlight. The sidewalks can be treacherous in west Petaluma, and you'll want to see those crags, cracks and upheavals in the concrete. Reflective clothing is also recommended so that vehicles can see you!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 mph (22 - 23 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike nearly 3.5 - 4.0 mph (we target a 16 minute mile, with multiple hills!)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?

Please take the time to RSVP YES when you plan on attending an event. It is equally important to keep your RSVP up to date. If you've RSVP'd YES for an event, we are going to wait for you until the departure time. We leave promptly at 6:10 PM, so if you arrive late you can join us along the route. We typically hike the same route for each hike, and our focus is on aerobic exercise.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

SCO Organizers

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

title: Free Estate Planning Webinar
location: https://mackaydressler.com/workshops/
description:
Creating your estate plan, whether it‚Äôs a living trust or a will, can be a daunting task. Estate planning addresses issues that are difficult to think about, such as death, incapacity, finances, and family dynamics. It can be easy to procrastinate, even though these issues may weigh heavily on your mind.

We invite you to attend one of our upcoming free webinars so you can take the first step toward having peace of mind by creating (or updating) your estate plan. This is an educational webinar, where we highlight some of the concerns that many families face and how an estate plan can help. The attorneys also break down how wills and trusts differ, and some of the common estate planning pitfalls and how to avoid them.

Our goal is to provide you with the education you need to protect yourself and your family, and leave a legacy of peace. If you would like to set up a meeting to discuss your estate planning needs further, we offer all participants who complete the webinar a free, no obligation personal consultation with one of the attorneys.

At this webinar, we will discuss several common issues and concerns, including:

  * The advantages and disadvantages of wills, living trusts, and probate
  * Protecting your children‚Äôs inheritance from their future ex-spouses, lawsuits, and other claims
  * Most living trusts fail; if you already have a trust, find out what you can do to ensure that it will protect you and your loved ones
  * How to preserve your nest egg for your family if you find yourself needing Long Term Care
  * How to stay out of court and avoid the cost, time, and stress that a conservatorship can bring if you become incapacitated.

Attend a webinar and receive a FREE no-obligation consultation with an Attorney to answer any questions about setting up your estate plan ($425 value).

title: Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown & Riverfront
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown and Riverfront

* Want to walk for fitness and exercise?
* New to walking and want to build up stamina?
* Like a slower pace than our Tuesday Night Fitness Hike?
* Would walking with a committed group of walkers help you?

If you said yes to any of these, then the Wednesday Night Walk in Petaluma is for you. We start at Aqus Cafe and take in the West Side of town, including some of Downtown, the Waterfront and a few of the Historic home of old Petaluma. We walk about 3-1/2 to 4-1/2 miles depending on weather conditions and the pace of the group that night.

Afterward if you have the time, join us at Aqus Cafe for a bite to eat and some liquid refreshment before heading home. Aqus Cafe is a true gem of a gathering place, restaurant, coffee house, and live music venue. But it's the people on either side of the counter that make this place so special.

DETAILS:

* Meetup time: 6:00pm (we hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Meetup location: Aqus Cafe
* Distance: 3.5 to 4-1/2 miles
* Duration: 75-80 minutes
* Pace: Easy/Moderate (about 2.5-3 mph or 20-24 minute miles)
* Difficulty: Easy (if you've walked 3-4 miles recently)
* Hills: Mostly flat with a few small and easy to climb hills
* Optional After-Hike Gathering at Aqus Cafe

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 - 3 mph (20-24 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is about 3.5-4 mph (15-17 minute miles)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks. You will not be spammed. If you are, let me know. Spamming will not be tolerated.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?
It's important to RSVP for these walks. When all the people have arrived for a walk that have RSVP'd, we leave... it might mean we leave early. If you didn't RSVP we are not going to wait for you. Plus, it's just a nice courtesy to the organizer and other participants. Please take the time to RSVP.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

Gary
SCO Organizer

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

title: Afternoon Hike at Annadel - Parktrail
description:
Mindfull Hikes
***Please be in good enough shape to hike at a moderate/fast steady pace (+/-2.5 mph) and comfortable with elevation changes.***

Celebrating the end of the day with a hike to Lake Ilsanjo.

**Distance:** +/- 5 miles total
**The hike:** A lollipop hike that includes Canyon, Lake (around the lake) and Spring Trails. There are some hills to climb on this hike.

**Parking:** Street parking on Parktrail Drive

**Where to Meet:** Intersection of Parktrail Drive and Comfrey Place on the sidewalk.

*Please be on time. We‚Äôll start promptly at the start time listed.* Give yourself a little extra time to arrive and get situated so that you‚Äôre part of the opening circle as this is an essential part of our time together.

**What to bring:** Snack, water, hat, good hiking shoes, a joyful spirit and laughter. Please dress appropriately for the weather that day. Layers of clothing are always advisable.
**===================================**
**Reminders:**
Mindful hikes are intended to be a way to connect more fully with ourselves, each other and with the land. There will be two periods of silent walking throughout the hike to allow the senses to be fully alive and felt. There will also be time during the hike to visit and connect with each other. These times of talking and connecting are an invitation to bring mindfulness to the present moment. **It's a time to put away the cell phone and cameras to disengage from technology to be fully present with each other, our *senses and the land we are inhabiting.***

***If you're on the waitlist for the hike and want to attend please message Vickie a few days before the scheduled hike. Most hikes have people drop off at the last minute and it's possible there is an opening.***

**DƒÅna**
In the spirit of the Buddhist tradition mindful hikes are offered as a dƒÅna based event. Rick Hansen says ‚Äúgenerosity is a beautiful practice that opens and gladdens the heart, relaxes the contraction of ‚Äòself‚Äô and ripples out into the world to touch many people.‚Äù The dƒÅna practice is **heart centered** and in the spirit of generosity. Venmo or cash is graciously accepted. Venmo account is: @vickieix8; last four digits 4714 of my phone # if asked.

**No-Show Policy:** Please cancel at least 24 hours before the start of the hike. Be mindful that there may be a waitlist. If your plans change and you're not coming, opening up a spot 4-5 days before the hike it's more likely someone will be able to attend than if you cancel at the last minute. You're considered a no-show if you cancel at the last minute. Members with 2 no-shows are removed from the group.

Source: Meetup Mindfull Hikes

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

title: The Jungle Book - By Missoula Children's Theater - 2/27 @ 7pm
location: Polly Klaas Community Theater, 417 Western Avenue, Petaluma, CA, 94952, United States
description:
PKF & PKCT in association with Missoula Children‚Äôs Theater present:
THE JUNGLE BOOK
Adapted by Michael McGill 
Music and Lyrics by Michael McGill 
Ever been abandoned in the jungle, adopted by wolves, taught by a bear, befriended by a panther and chased by a tiger? In the Missoula Children‚Äôs Theatre musical adaptation of THE JUNGLE BOOK, Mowgli the man-cub has all these adventures and more. Join him as he escapes from the Bander-log, outwits a tiger, enlists the help of a rock-python, explores what it means to be human and learns a lesson from the brave mongoose Rikki-Tikki-Tavi. Original music and rollicking humor give new life to the classic tale by Rudyard Kipling. 
Three shows are scheduled: 2/27 at 7pm and 2/28 at 2pm and 5:30pm. Get your tickets now to see local kids put on an amazing performance of this classic; all auditioned, rehearsed, produced, and presented in just one week! 
Celebrating over 50 years of touring, the Missoula Children‚Äôs Theatre International Tour has fostered developmental life skills in more than a million kids. Our tour reaches 65,000 children in more than 1,000 communities in all 50 states and 15+ countries each year. One of the many ways the Missoula Children‚Äôs Theatre remains vibrant is through generous donors all over the world. 
GET YOUR TICKETS HERE >>

Source: Polly Klaas Community Theater

title: XO Chips XO, Halou and Identical Homes
location: The Big Easy, 128 American Alley, Petaluma, CA, 94952, United States
description:
Petaluma‚Äôs own Xo Chips Xo makes tightly constructed electronic music that leans toward 80s minimal pop‚Äîcrisp beats, angular bass/synth lines, balancing precision with a dry, playful edge. 
Halou is the long-running project of Ryan and Rebecca Coseboom who quietly built a deeply devoted audience by writing music that feels like an internal conversation. Their sound blends dream-pop, electronic atmospheres, and intimate songwriting that has resonated far beyond expectations.  
Identical Homes is the experimental project of California-based musician and producer Daniel McKenzie, known for his work in bands like The Rum Diary, Built for the Sea, and Shuteye Unison. With Identical Homes, he creates a deeply atmospheric and exploratory sonic world, blending elements of ambient, post-rock, electronic, and art-pop. Live, Daniel is joined by Jake Krohn (Shuteye Unison, The Action Design), Lia Rose (Built for the Sea), and Greg Kelly (Sunset Junior, Fight Like Fight). Together, they trade instruments often, weaving between ambient interludes, tribal rhythms, and dreamy pop choruses.

Source: The Big Easy

He was vocalist and guitarist for the South Bay band OTR, winners of the KFOX Last Band Standing competition in 2010, and subsequently, in 2015, started a very successful acoustic act, P.S. Acoustic Music, performing in solo, duo, and trio formats at numerous South Bay venues. title: Opening Reception: "Collaborative Works 2026" by Connect the Dots Art Studio
location: Petaluma, CA
description:
Collaborative Works 2026" showcases a selection of paintings and textiles by Anna Rochester and Barbara Libby-Steinmann. This approach yields both large-scale and smaller works, which are on view at Usher Gallery from February 17th to March 22nd.

Join us for the opening reception on Saturday, February 28th, from 5-8pm to celebrate ‚ÄúCollaborative Works 2026‚Äù, enjoy live music by Rojo, meet the artists, and graze on light refreshments and wine.

Anna and Barbara serve as co-directors of Connect the Dots Art Studio (CTD), a recently established arts-based nonprofit in Marin. CTD brings people together to experience art through installations, workshops, and events that invite individuals to tap into and express their creativity. THE JUNGLE BOOK
Adapted by Michael McGill 
Music and Lyrics by Michael McGill 
Ever been abandoned in the jungle, adopted by wolves, taught by a bear, befriended by a panther and chased by a tiger? In the Missoula Children‚Äôs Theatre musical adaptation of THE JUNGLE BOOK, Mowgli the man-cub has all these adventures and more. Join him as he escapes from the Bander-log, outwits a tiger, enlists the help of a rock-python, explores what it means to be human and learns a lesson from the brave mongoose Rikki-Tikki-Tavi. Original music and rollicking humor give new life to the classic tale by Rudyard Kipling. 
Three shows are scheduled: 2/27 at 7pm and 2/28 at 2pm and 5:30pm. Get your tickets now to see local kids put on an amazing performance of this classic; all auditioned, rehearsed, produced, and presented in just one week! 
Celebrating over 50 years of touring, the Missoula Children‚Äôs Theatre International Tour has fostered developmental life skills in more than a million kids. Our tour reaches 65,000 children in more than 1,000 communities in all 50 states and 15+ countries each year. One of the many ways the Missoula Children‚Äôs Theatre remains vibrant is through generous donors all over the world.

You may stay on for a potluck meal at 11:00 am. Welcome to bring a dish to share.

title: Mindfulness Sunday Meditation: Cultivating Consciousness
description:
Meditate with a Monk in Sonoma County
Join us for a transformative workshop on mindfulness meditation and cultivating consciousness. Dive deep into the teachings of Theravada Buddhism, focusing on insight meditation to develop a clear understanding of the nature of the mind and consciousness. This workshop will include guided meditation sessions to help you strengthen your meditation practice and cultivate mindfulness in your daily life. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced meditator, this workshop offers a welcoming space to explore the depths of your own consciousness and enhance your spiritual journey. Come together with like-minded individuals to deepen your practice and connect with the wisdom of Theravada Buddhism, and provide an opportunity to deepen mindfulness, wisdom, and inner stillness.
Our sessions are led by Bhikkhunis closely associated with our Dhammadharini Sangha. Check out the [recording from the past event](https://youtube.com/live/s07U2kzWoWk?feature=share) on our YouTube channel.
You‚Äôre also welcome to join us in person at Dhammadharini Monastery, in the peaceful setting of our outdoor Dana Sala Pavilion
Register for this event on Dhammadharini's website to receive the address:
[https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2](https://www.dhammadharini.net/event-details/sunday-morning-guided-meditation-questions-2)

title: English Country Dance Sebastopol
description:
North Bay Contra Dance
English country dancing is done in long lines (like contra), circles, or in geometric sets (squares, triangles). Like our contra dances, there is live music and a caller. You can come by yourself or with friends, since we change partners after each dance. If you‚Äôve ever done contra or square dancing, much of our dance vocabulary will be familiar to you since both of those styles evolved from English country dancing.

The dance is held the 1st and 3rd Sundays of each month, 2-4:30 pm, to live music, all levels of experience welcome; and occasional 5th Sundays for Advanced dancers. Admission is $15 for members of NBCDS and its affiliates, $8 for young adults ages 19-30, and $3 for youth ages 6 ‚Äì 18.

title: Petaluma Contra Dance
description:
North Bay Contra Dance
Contra Dance is fun, quick to learn, and great exercise. Every dance night has a live band, caller, and a quick start class for first timers.
In contra dance, you will dance with your partner but also with other couples as you progress down the line. The figures for each dance are done in a repeated sequence after a brief walk through by the caller. Each dance may last 10 ‚Äì 12 minutes and then we encourage you to switch partners as the night goes on.
What to wear: Comfortable shoes that will enable you to pivot and slide on the wood floor.
When to arrive: If this is your first time, come 30 minutes early to check in, join the quick start class, and get you ready for the first dance.
How hard to learn? Most newcomers will find that they can get dancing right away as the figures are quite simple.
Come as a group, couple, or single! Our dance is inclusive to all ages and genders.
Cost: $13 members, $15 non-members, $8 student or limited income.

Source: Meetup Contra Dance

title: Tuesday Night Fitness Hike: 5+ Fast Miles, Downtown Petaluma and Western Hills
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
WARNING: THE TUESDAY NIGHT FITNESS HIKE IS AN AEROBIC, FAST-PACED URBAN HIKE! WE TARGET A PACE OF 16-MINUTES PER MILE WITH ONLY BRIEF STOPS (TO REGROUP AS NEEDED). OUR SUMMER ROUTE INCLUDES THE HILLS IN HELEN PUTNAM PARK (740 FT. ELEVATION GAIN), AND OUR WINTER ROUTE EXPLORES THE WATER TANKS (690 FT. ELEVATION GAIN). IF YOU FIND YOU ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY KEEPING UP WITH THE LEADERS IN THIS GROUP, PLEASE USE THE OPT-OUT POINT AT THE FIRST MILE OF THE HIKE! ANOTHER OPTION IS OUR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WALK FOR A MORE MODERATE PACE. THANK YOU FOR HELPING ME KEEP THIS HIKE AN AEROBIC WORKOUT!

NOTE:
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is posted on the SCO Calendar every week. Steve Tubbs is shown as the host each week but he might, or might not, show up to the event. This is, more often than not, a small group of regular, fit walkers who show up on time every Tuesday night to enjoy this rigorous walk. We leave promptly at 6:10 pm from the Kentucky Street entrance to the LanMart Building. So, if you don't see Steve on the Tuesday night you are there, you might see him on the next one.

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike, 5+ miles fast paced urban hike:

This Fitness Hike includes multiple steep uphill portions in Helen Putnam Park (during Daylight Savings Time), and at the Petaluma Water Tanks (after Daylight Savings Time ends).

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike:

* Warning! This is a FAST hike... a real workout!
* 5+ miles
* Meetup time 6:00 pm (We hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Difficulty is STRENUOUS!
* 90 minutes

This is a fast, evening Fitness Hike that starts downtown outside (on the sidewalk) of the LanMart Building (Brixx Restaurant, Heebe Jeebe) on Kentucky Street. We head west to Helen Putnam Park (or the Petaluma Water Tanks when DST ends) for some beautiful vistas before returning to our starting point on Kentucky Street. This hike is generally the same route and is focused primarily on fitness.

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking/hiking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

WHAT ABOUT THE DARKNESS?
Bring a SMALL flashlight. The sidewalks can be treacherous in west Petaluma, and you'll want to see those crags, cracks and upheavals in the concrete. Reflective clothing is also recommended so that vehicles can see you!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 mph (22 - 23 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike nearly 3.5 - 4.0 mph (we target a 16 minute mile, with multiple hills!)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?

Please take the time to RSVP YES when you plan on attending an event. It is equally important to keep your RSVP up to date. If you've RSVP'd YES for an event, we are going to wait for you until the departure time. We leave promptly at 6:10 PM, so if you arrive late you can join us along the route. We typically hike the same route for each hike, and our focus is on aerobic exercise.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

SCO Organizers

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

Hawken illuminates the subtle connections between carbon and our collective human experience and asks us to see nature, carbon, and ourselves as exquisitely intertwined‚Äîinseparably connected.   [ { "id": "04388466-7135-4ccc-9916-e993de72b63e" } ] Get your copy & start reading: Petaluma Library GoodReads Copperfield‚Äôs Books - Tell them you are with the Cool Petaluma Book Club for 10% discount! #block-3c015c478e7126068ac5 { box-sizing: border-box; height: 100%; padding: 6% 6% 6% 6%; border-radius: 0px 0px 0px 0px; }

title: UPDATE: 1st Wednesday! Wednesday Night Walk start at STARBUCKS  on the East Side
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma East Side Green Belt

* Want to walk for fitness and exercise?
* New to walking and want to build up stamina?
* Like a slower pace than our Tuesday Night Fitness Hike?
* Would walking with a committed group of walkers help you?

If you said yes to any of these, then the Wednesday Night Walk in Petaluma is for you. We start at STARBUCKS at the leghorn shopping center, and walk about 4-1/2 miles depending on weather conditions and the pace of the group that night.

DETAILS:

* Meetup time: 6:00pm (we walk at 6:10 sharp)
* Meetup location: STARBUCKS
* Distance: \~ 4.5 miles
* Duration: 75-80 minutes
* Pace: Easy/Moderate (about 2.5-3 mph or 20-24 minute miles)
* Difficulty: Easy (if you've walked 3-4 miles recently)
* Hills: Mostly flat
* Optional After-walk gathering at
* WHAT TO BRING:
* A good pair of walking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 - 3 mph (20-24 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is about 3.5-4 mph (15-17 minute miles)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks. You will not be spammed. If you are, let me know. Spamming will not be tolerated.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?
It's important to RSVP for these walks. When all the people have arrived for a walk that have RSVP'd, we leave... it might mean we leave early. If you didn't RSVP we are not going to wait for you. Plus, it's just a nice courtesy to the organizer and other participants. Please take the time to RSVP.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

Gary
SCO Organizer

title: Bothe Napa Valley State Park
description:
Go Wild Hikers
Spring is almost here. **Daylight Savings Time Begins**
**Set your clocks Ahead One Hour or you'll miss the hike.** Join us for a hike in Napa Valley. Bothe is 1900 acres of beautiful redwoods, bay laurel, madrones and moss-covered Douglas fir, orchids, trilliums and wildflowers (in season), spotted owls, pileated woodpeckers and forest pigeons, springs, creeks and ferns. You will not be disappointed! A challenging hike, best for individuals with at least a moderate level of fitness.

**Where We Meet/Directions**
Bothe Napa Valley State Park
3801 St. Helena Hwy (Highway 29/128), Calistoga, CA 94515
The park is located approximately 5 miles north of St. Helena and 4 miles south of Calistoga on Highway 29/128.
After passing the **entrance & Pay Station** follow the road to a large parking area. There are bathrooms past this parking lot about 200 yards.
Give yourself plenty of time to arrive, pay park fee and use the toilet. It often takes longer than you think.

**After Hike Gathering?**
The Calistoga Creamery
1473 Lincoln Avenue, Calistoga 94515
https://www.yelp.com/biz/calistoga-creamery-calistoga
An outstanding ice cream shop! Opens at 12 pm Sat and Sun.
Organic ice cream and organic frozen yogurt, thick custom milk shakes, root beer floats and sundaes. No high fructose corn syrup, artificial colors or flavors. No hydrogenated oils and no GMOs.

**Group Hike #334**
Coyote Peak Trail to Ritchey Canyon Trail - A loop hike
Distance - 6 miles/9.7 kilometers
Elevation change - 1100 feet/335 meters
Difficulty - 7+ out of 10 - moderate
Exposures - 20 % sun/ 80% shade- rocky, creek crossings, mud, poison oak, ticks & insects.
Bring plenty of water. At least 68 oz./2 liters
Dogs - Not permitted
Facilities at trail head - Shade, picnic table, restrooms down the road.
Cost - $5 cash
Parking - State Parks fee of $8 or free with your State Park Pass.
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring plenty of water, a hat, a snack/lunch and layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course, we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**When We Meet**
Sunday March 8, 2026
**Daylight Savings Time Begins**
**Set your clocks Ahead One Hour or you'll miss the hike.**
9:00 am - 12:30 pm PDT
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP.
Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or any other contagion!
Hike may be changed, rescheduled or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

**Notice to New Hikers Only**
**"When a New Hiker (never hiked with me before) doesn't show up (No Show) to their first hike with the group, they will be removed (not banned) from the group immediately."**

Source: Meetup: Go Wild Hikers

title: Tuesday Night Fitness Hike: 5+ Fast Miles, Downtown Petaluma and Western Hills
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
WARNING: THE TUESDAY NIGHT FITNESS HIKE IS AN AEROBIC, FAST-PACED URBAN HIKE! WE TARGET A PACE OF 16-MINUTES PER MILE WITH ONLY BRIEF STOPS (TO REGROUP AS NEEDED). OUR SUMMER ROUTE INCLUDES THE HILLS IN HELEN PUTNAM PARK (740 FT. ELEVATION GAIN), AND OUR WINTER ROUTE EXPLORES THE WATER TANKS (690 FT. ELEVATION GAIN). IF YOU FIND YOU ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY KEEPING UP WITH THE LEADERS IN THIS GROUP, PLEASE USE THE OPT-OUT POINT AT THE FIRST MILE OF THE HIKE! ANOTHER OPTION IS OUR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WALK FOR A MORE MODERATE PACE. THANK YOU FOR HELPING ME KEEP THIS HIKE AN AEROBIC WORKOUT!

NOTE:
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is posted on the SCO Calendar every week. Steve Tubbs is shown as the host each week but he might, or might not, show up to the event. This is, more often than not, a small group of regular, fit walkers who show up on time every Tuesday night to enjoy this rigorous walk. We leave promptly at 6:10 pm from the Kentucky Street entrance to the LanMart Building. So, if you don't see Steve on the Tuesday night you are there, you might see him on the next one.

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike, 5+ miles fast paced urban hike:

This Fitness Hike includes multiple steep uphill portions in Helen Putnam Park (during Daylight Savings Time), and at the Petaluma Water Tanks (after Daylight Savings Time ends).

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike:

* Warning! This is a FAST hike... a real workout!
* 5+ miles
* Meetup time 6:00 pm (We hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Difficulty is STRENUOUS!
* 90 minutes

This is a fast, evening Fitness Hike that starts downtown outside (on the sidewalk) of the LanMart Building (Brixx Restaurant, Heebe Jeebe) on Kentucky Street. We head west to Helen Putnam Park (or the Petaluma Water Tanks when DST ends) for some beautiful vistas before returning to our starting point on Kentucky Street. This hike is generally the same route and is focused primarily on fitness.

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking/hiking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

WHAT ABOUT THE DARKNESS?
Bring a SMALL flashlight. The sidewalks can be treacherous in west Petaluma, and you'll want to see those crags, cracks and upheavals in the concrete. Reflective clothing is also recommended so that vehicles can see you!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 mph (22 - 23 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike nearly 3.5 - 4.0 mph (we target a 16 minute mile, with multiple hills!)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?

Please take the time to RSVP YES when you plan on attending an event. It is equally important to keep your RSVP up to date. If you've RSVP'd YES for an event, we are going to wait for you until the departure time. We leave promptly at 6:10 PM, so if you arrive late you can join us along the route. We typically hike the same route for each hike, and our focus is on aerobic exercise.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

SCO Organizers

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

title: The Hidden Girl and Other Stories
description:
Petaluma Book (And Brew) Club
From stories about time-travelling assassins to *Black Mirror*-esque tales of cryptocurreny and internet trolling, to heartbreaking narratives of parent-child relationships, *The Hidden Girl and Other Stories* is a far-reaching work that explores topical themes from the present and a visionary look at humanity's future.

This collection includes a selection of Liu's speculative fiction stories over the past five years ‚Äî seventeen of his best ‚Äî plus a new novelette. In addition, it also features an excerpt from the *The Veiled Throne*, the third book in Liu's epic fantasy series *The Dandelion Dynasty*.

title: Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown & Riverfront
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown and Riverfront

* Want to walk for fitness and exercise?
* New to walking and want to build up stamina?
* Like a slower pace than our Tuesday Night Fitness Hike?
* Would walking with a committed group of walkers help you?

If you said yes to any of these, then the Wednesday Night Walk in Petaluma is for you. We start at Aqus Cafe and take in the West Side of town, including some of Downtown, the Waterfront and a few of the Historic home of old Petaluma. We walk about 3-1/2 to 4-1/2 miles depending on weather conditions and the pace of the group that night.

Afterward if you have the time, join us at Aqus Cafe for a bite to eat and some liquid refreshment before heading home. Aqus Cafe is a true gem of a gathering place, restaurant, coffee house, and live music venue. But it's the people on either side of the counter that make this place so special.

DETAILS:

* Meetup time: 6:00pm (we hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Meetup location: Aqus Cafe
* Distance: 3.5 to 4-1/2 miles
* Duration: 75-80 minutes
* Pace: Easy/Moderate (about 2.5-3 mph or 20-24 minute miles)
* Difficulty: Easy (if you've walked 3-4 miles recently)
* Hills: Mostly flat with a few small and easy to climb hills
* Optional After-Hike Gathering at Aqus Cafe

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 - 3 mph (20-24 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is about 3.5-4 mph (15-17 minute miles)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks. You will not be spammed. If you are, let me know. Spamming will not be tolerated.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?
It's important to RSVP for these walks. When all the people have arrived for a walk that have RSVP'd, we leave... it might mean we leave early. If you didn't RSVP we are not going to wait for you. Plus, it's just a nice courtesy to the organizer and other participants. Please take the time to RSVP.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

Gary
SCO Organizer

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

description:

This juried exhibition looks beyond nostalgia to examine how familiar symbols, stories, and styles evolve over time‚Äîbridging the past and present through creativity and craft.  ‚ÄúAmericana‚Äù has long served as a reflection of everyday life and culture, from small-town iconography and handmade crafts to design movements and popular imagery. In Americana Reimagined artists reexamine this broad theme, juxtaposing the old and the new, and honoring timeless motifs while offering fresh perspectives on what they mean today. title: Inez Storer Exhibition
location: 230 Lakeville Street, Petaluma, CA  94952
description:
[ { "type": "highlight", "id": "481f9063-c358-4f54-ba25-2bb0e1e78086", "shape": "underline", "isFront": false, "isAnimationEnabled": false, "animation": "draw", "duration": 0.5, "direction": "right", "color": { "type": "THEME_COLOR" }, "thickness": { "unit": "em", "value": 0.1 }, "linecap": "square" } ] States of Anxiety, States of Hope Exhibition Dates: March 12 - April 18, 2026 Opening Reception: Thursday, March 12, 5:30-7:30pm States of Anxiety, States of Hope  presents a selection of works by artist Inez Storer that reflect on the emotional, cultural, and political complexities of contemporary life. Building on themes explored in   Americana Reimagined ,  Storer‚Äôs paintings offer a layered meditation on identity, memory, and collective experience in times of uncertainty and transformation. Through her distinctive magical realist collage method, Storer constructs richly textured visual narratives that merge personal history with broader social realities. Her works are composed of fragments‚Äîsymbols, images, and artifacts drawn from her life and interests. Storer's paintings guide the viewer on a journey through both historical memory and internal landscapes. They balance darkness and light, anxiety and hope.  She asks us to reflect on the conditions of our moment. States of Anxiety, States of Hope affirms art‚Äôs capacity to illuminate struggle while nurturing resilience, empathy, and connection. Biography Storer lives in Inverness, California, and has a studio in Point Reyes Station. Born in Santa Monica in 1933 to a Catholic father and Jewish mother, she spent time on Hollywood movie sets where her father worked as an art director. Influenced by stage design, her work often creates a sense of ‚Äútheatrical space‚Äù and reflects her ancestry. Shortly before her death, her mother revealed that she had fled Germany to escape Nazism. Storer later learned of cousins who escaped on the Kindertransport. The frustration of being kept from the truth has infused her work with a distinct angst. Her work is held in many collections including the Jewish Museum in New York, Manetti Shrem Museum of Art at UC Davis, Oakland Museum of Art , the de Young Museum, San Jos√© Museum of Art, Monterey Museum of Art, Missoula Museum of Art, and the National Museum of American Jewish History. At the same time, our friends at IceHouse Gallery will hold a companion exhibition of Storer‚Äôs Works on Paper. Exhibition dates are March 7 - March 28. title: Catering to the Car: A Retro Road Trip Down Petaluma‚Äôs Main Street
location: 230 Lakeville Street, Petaluma, CA 94952
description:
Hollie's 616 PBS Credit Paul Barber Collection Americana Reimagined at its best, this presentation will step into Petaluma‚Äôs living history with historian Katherine Rinehart as she shares stories behind some of Petaluma‚Äôs classic examples of roadside architecture. Discover how, through adaptive reuse, these properties reveal the economic and social trends that shaped the city‚Äôs past while continuing to serve the needs of today. Get tickets #block-7ac69afb6caf81033ffe {--sqs-block-content-flex: 0; } Katherine J. Rinehart is a consulting historian specializing in house history documentation, archival organization, research, and exhibit development. She holds an MA in History from Sonoma State University and recently founded the Petaluma Signs Project,  dedicated to preserving historic signs that enrich our unique identity. Previously, Katherine managed the Sonoma County History & Genealogy Library. Her current clients include Sonoma State University Library and the Tomales Regional History Center. Katherine is an official Petaluma Good Egg, an annual honor celebrating individuals who advance the story of the city's unique past. She is the author of Petaluma: A History in Architecture and co-authored The Petaluma River: A Sketch Journal and Brief Historical Overview and the Petaluma Vintage Signs Guidebook. 

Source: Petaluma Arts Center

title: San Rafael Contra Dance
description:
North Bay Contra Dance
Contra Dance is fun, quick to learn, and great exercise. Every dance night has a live band, caller, and a quick start class for first timers.
In contra dance, you will dance with your partner but also with other couples as you progress down the line. The figures for each dance are done in a repeated sequence after a brief walk through by the caller. Each dance may last 10 ‚Äì 12 minutes and then we encourage you to switch partners as the night goes on.
What to wear: Comfortable shoes that will enable you to pivot and slide on the wood floor.
When to arrive: If this is your first time, come 30 minutes early to check in, join the quick start class, and get you ready for the first dance.
How hard to learn? Most newcomers will find that they can get dancing right away as the figures are quite simple.
Come as a group, couple, or single! Our dance is inclusive to all ages and genders.
Cost: *Free to first-time dancers*. $13 members, $15 non-members, $8 student or limited income.

Source: Meetup Contra Dance

title: Men of Worth
location: Mercury Theater, 3333 Petaluma Blvd N, Petaluma, CA 94952
description:
Men of Worth Monday March 16 at 6:30pm A night of celtic folk music with Men of Worth. In 1986, Scotsman Donnie Macdonald and Irishman James Keigher came together to perform Irish and Scottish folk music, combining traditional and contemporary styles. The name "Men of Worth" was chosen from the title of a folk song written by the Scottish singer/songwriter Archie Fisher. Together Men of Worth blend their voices with harmony and support their collection of songs with their varied selection of instruments. They have a very simple approach to their presentation, and in keeping with tradition, remain true to the music and story. Their show is a unique combination of humour, exciting tunes, and soulful, heartfelt ballads. Men of Worth are an international act, and have earned much respect and success in over thirty years of touring together. Performing concerts and festivals, with twelve albums to their credit; Men of Worth continue the very tradition from which they've evolved.

Source: Mercury Theater

title: Tuesday Night Fitness Hike: 5+ Fast Miles, Downtown Petaluma and Western Hills
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
WARNING: THE TUESDAY NIGHT FITNESS HIKE IS AN AEROBIC, FAST-PACED URBAN HIKE! WE TARGET A PACE OF 16-MINUTES PER MILE WITH ONLY BRIEF STOPS (TO REGROUP AS NEEDED). OUR SUMMER ROUTE INCLUDES THE HILLS IN HELEN PUTNAM PARK (740 FT. ELEVATION GAIN), AND OUR WINTER ROUTE EXPLORES THE WATER TANKS (690 FT. ELEVATION GAIN). IF YOU FIND YOU ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY KEEPING UP WITH THE LEADERS IN THIS GROUP, PLEASE USE THE OPT-OUT POINT AT THE FIRST MILE OF THE HIKE! ANOTHER OPTION IS OUR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WALK FOR A MORE MODERATE PACE. THANK YOU FOR HELPING ME KEEP THIS HIKE AN AEROBIC WORKOUT!

NOTE:
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is posted on the SCO Calendar every week. Steve Tubbs is shown as the host each week but he might, or might not, show up to the event. This is, more often than not, a small group of regular, fit walkers who show up on time every Tuesday night to enjoy this rigorous walk. We leave promptly at 6:10 pm from the Kentucky Street entrance to the LanMart Building. So, if you don't see Steve on the Tuesday night you are there, you might see him on the next one.

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike, 5+ miles fast paced urban hike:

This Fitness Hike includes multiple steep uphill portions in Helen Putnam Park (during Daylight Savings Time), and at the Petaluma Water Tanks (after Daylight Savings Time ends).

Tuesday Night Fitness Hike:

* Warning! This is a FAST hike... a real workout!
* 5+ miles
* Meetup time 6:00 pm (We hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Difficulty is STRENUOUS!
* 90 minutes

This is a fast, evening Fitness Hike that starts downtown outside (on the sidewalk) of the LanMart Building (Brixx Restaurant, Heebe Jeebe) on Kentucky Street. We head west to Helen Putnam Park (or the Petaluma Water Tanks when DST ends) for some beautiful vistas before returning to our starting point on Kentucky Street. This hike is generally the same route and is focused primarily on fitness.

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking/hiking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

WHAT ABOUT THE DARKNESS?
Bring a SMALL flashlight. The sidewalks can be treacherous in west Petaluma, and you'll want to see those crags, cracks and upheavals in the concrete. Reflective clothing is also recommended so that vehicles can see you!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 mph (22 - 23 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike nearly 3.5 - 4.0 mph (we target a 16 minute mile, with multiple hills!)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?

Please take the time to RSVP YES when you plan on attending an event. It is equally important to keep your RSVP up to date. If you've RSVP'd YES for an event, we are going to wait for you until the departure time. We leave promptly at 6:10 PM, so if you arrive late you can join us along the route. We typically hike the same route for each hike, and our focus is on aerobic exercise.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

SCO Organizers

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors

title: Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown & Riverfront
description:
"SONOMA COUNTY OUTDOORS"
Wednesday Night Walk: Petaluma Downtown and Riverfront

* Want to walk for fitness and exercise?
* New to walking and want to build up stamina?
* Like a slower pace than our Tuesday Night Fitness Hike?
* Would walking with a committed group of walkers help you?

If you said yes to any of these, then the Wednesday Night Walk in Petaluma is for you. We start at Aqus Cafe and take in the West Side of town, including some of Downtown, the Waterfront and a few of the Historic home of old Petaluma. We walk about 3-1/2 to 4-1/2 miles depending on weather conditions and the pace of the group that night.

Afterward if you have the time, join us at Aqus Cafe for a bite to eat and some liquid refreshment before heading home. Aqus Cafe is a true gem of a gathering place, restaurant, coffee house, and live music venue. But it's the people on either side of the counter that make this place so special.

DETAILS:

* Meetup time: 6:00pm (we hike at 6:10 sharp)
* Meetup location: Aqus Cafe
* Distance: 3.5 to 4-1/2 miles
* Duration: 75-80 minutes
* Pace: Easy/Moderate (about 2.5-3 mph or 20-24 minute miles)
* Difficulty: Easy (if you've walked 3-4 miles recently)
* Hills: Mostly flat with a few small and easy to climb hills
* Optional After-Hike Gathering at Aqus Cafe

WHAT TO BRING:

* A good pair of walking shoes
* Water (you'll be glad you did)
* A fun attitude!

SO HOW FAST ARE WE WALKING?
The Wednesday Night Walk is about 2.5 - 3 mph (20-24 minute miles)
The Tuesday Night Fitness Hike is about 3.5-4 mph (15-17 minute miles)

HOW DO YOU PARTICIPATE?
Sign up with Meetup and RSVP Today! This also gets you on our email list to make you aware of upcoming events, hikes and walks. You will not be spammed. If you are, let me know. Spamming will not be tolerated.

WHY DO YOU NEED TO RSVP?
It's important to RSVP for these walks. When all the people have arrived for a walk that have RSVP'd, we leave... it might mean we leave early. If you didn't RSVP we are not going to wait for you. Plus, it's just a nice courtesy to the organizer and other participants. Please take the time to RSVP.

QUESTIONS?
Email me with any questions by using the "Contact Us" link on the left hand side bar of this meetup group page.

Hope to see you on a walk or hike soon!

Gary
SCO Organizer

Source: Meetup Sonoma Outdoors
