title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

title: In Conversation with Inez Storer
location: 230 Lakeville Street, Petaluma, CA 94952
description:
In Conversation with Inez Storer Sunday, April 12, 4:00-5:00pm $15 members; $20 non-members An afternoon conversation about Inez‚Äôs approach to artmaking, her family history and the stories that inform her art. There will be time for questions. Storer lives in Inverness, California, and has a studio in Point Reyes Station. Born in Santa Monica in 1933 to a Catholic father and Jewish mother, she spent time on Hollywood movie sets where her father worked as an art director. Influenced by stage design, her work often creates a sense of ‚Äútheatrical space‚Äù and reflects her ancestry. Shortly before her death, her mother revealed that she had fled Germany to escape Nazism. Storer later learned of cousins who escaped on the Kindertransport. The frustration of being kept from the truth has infused her work with a distinct angst. Her work is held in many collections including the Jewish Museum in New York, Manetti Shrem Museum of Art at UC Davis, Oakland Museum of Art , the de Young Museum, San Jos√© Museum of Art, Monterey Museum of Art, Missoula Museum of Art, and the National Museum of American Jewish History. Get tickets #block-1561e173823053783d43 {--sqs-block-content-flex: 0; }

title: Headwaters to Headwaters Hike & BBQ - Sugarloaf Fundraising Event
description:
Mindfull Hikes
Let's support our local state park and hike this amazing adventure together.

A fundraiser for Sugarloaf Ridge State Park and Mayacamas hiking adventure. Join Sonoma Ecology Center and Team Sugarloaf for an unforgettable journey through the heart of Sonoma County's most pristine and breathtaking landscapes, in our exclusive fundraising hike on **Saturday, April 18, 2026** at **[Sugarloaf Ridge State Park](http://www.sugarloafpark.org/)**!

Participants will arrive at Sugarloaf Ridge State Park by 8:45 am, with shuttle buses departing at 9:00 am for Hood Mountain Regional Park. The hike begins at the Los Alamos parking lot, taking the Santa Rosa Creek Trail to Homestead Meadow and entering Sugarloaf via the McCormick Addition. The route ascends Quercus Trail, passes the former site of the Grandmother Oak, and stops briefly at Red Hill before continuing up Maple Glen Trail. After lunch atop ‚ÄúHill 2530,‚Äù hikers return to Sugarloaf via ascending Bald Mountain, concluding with a barbecue dinner in the day-use area around 3:30 pm. The journey spans roughly ***11 miles and climbs 3,200 ft in elevation.***

**To register:** https://sec.regfox.com/headwaters-2026
**Cost of ticket:** $130
Ticket includes parking, shuttle transportation to Hood Mountain, snacks, drinks, a commemorative enamel pin, and a BBQ dinner.
Post-hike BBQ dinner, starting at 4:30 pm.

**Ticket sales end on April 5 and may sell out before this date.**

Source: Meetup Mindfull Hikes

title: Butter & Egg Days Parade & Festival 2026
location: Petaluma, CA
description:
Theme: "America's Birthday - Petaluma Style" Celebrating 250 years of independence, ingenuity, and small-town pride. ‚ÄúAmericas‚Äô Birthday ‚Äì Petaluma Style‚Äù celebrates the nation‚Äôs 250th Birthday by honoring Petaluma‚Äôs deep agricultural roots and hometown spirit. This year‚Äôs Butter & Egg Days Parade recognizes the farmers, families, immigrants, makers, entrepreneurs, and creatives whose hard work, imagination, and ingenuity reflect the enduring American Dream. This celebration also pays respect to the Indigenous peoples who first stewarded this land, the courage of our founders, and the dedication of the dairy and egg farming community that shaped our town. Rooted in community, innovation, and independence, the parade celebrates the small-town spirit that continues to make Petaluma a vibrant place to call home. Head to Downtown Petaluma and celebrate with our community on this day of fun, history, and local pride! Parade participants incorporate the theme ‚ÄúAmerica's Birthday - Petaluma S

Source: Petaluma Chamber of Commerce

title: Butter & Egg Days Parade and Festival
location: Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
2026 Annual Butter & Egg Days Parade and Festival

Date: Saturday, April 18, 2026

Step into Petaluma's flowering world of curiosity and delight!

The 2026 Butter & Egg Days Parade will take place Saturday, April 18. Participants and spectators alike to celebrate the magic and charm of our historic town. Colorful floats, costumed participants, and lively performances will celebrate Petaluma‚Äôs rich history and agricultural heritage. Join in a day of fun and local pride that promises to delight visitors of all ages!

The Butter & Egg Days festivities kick off on Saturday, April 11 with the Opening Ceremonies at the Petaluma Historical Library and Museum (20 Fourth St), from Noon to 1pm. Mayor Kevin McDonnell will read a proclamation honoring the Grand Marshal and Good Egg. Come enjoy this display that shows the heart of our community.

One week later on Saturday, April 18, the Butter & Egg Days Parade steps off at noon and will march through the historic downtown. The parade will showcase over 100 units with approximately 3,000 participants and 200 volunteers. Clover Sonoma will return to lead the Clover Kids‚Äô Parade, which precedes the main parade at 11:30am with a procession of preschoolers and primary grade youngsters and their families.

The parade is surrounded by a Festival that spreads over four city blocks from 10am-5pm offering a wide variety of food, crafts, beverage gardens, two large kid areas, live music, and more! This annual event aims to bring together the community for a day of fun and entertainment.

The following weekend, Downtown Petaluma continues the celebration with our Annual Antique Faire, on Sunday, April 26.

Visit ButterAndEggDays.com http://www.ButterAndEggDays.com for more information.

Happy Butter & Egg Days!!

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

title: Petaluma Spring Antique Faire
location: Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
Petaluma Spring Antique Faire

The much-anticipated Petaluma Spring Antique Faire returns on April 26, from 8am to 4pm, in Historic Downtown Petaluma. The Faire is located on Western Ave, the A Street Parking lot, and 4th & Kentucky Streets between B Street and Washington Street.

"The Bay Area's Premier Antique Center," Historic Downtown Petaluma will transform into an antique marketplace. Amid the beautiful historic buildings, one-of-a-kind stores, an incredible array of restaurants and cafes, guests can find an incomparable selection of affordable antiques from over 200 dealers. The show has a fantastic variety of estate jewelry, linens, furniture, art, kitchenware, vintage d√©cor, books, and all kinds of unusual collectibles to suit everyone's budget.

Antique and collectible lovers throughout the Bay Area are welcome to browse and shop the 40th Annual Petaluma Antique Faire set in our delightful and relaxing downtown Petaluma.

This show attracts over 8k discerning collectors as well as first-time buyers wishing to collect and invest in real antiques.

Visit http://petalumadowntown.com

~ Admission is free ~

location: The Big Easy, 128 American Alley, Petaluma, CA, 94952, United States
description:
The last show was such a success we are going to do it again! Save the date for May 2nd. 
Thotty McNaughty presents an evening of classic Live Jazz From Award-Winning Cabaret Chanteuse Coco Lamarr. In 2021, Coco was awarded Best Vocalist and Best Film at the Hollywood & Southern California Burlesque Film Festival. In July 2024, Coco won first place at The Battle of The Ballads singing competition at Juliet Cocktail Room inside the Venetian Casino & Resort. And in 2025, she launched The Winehouse Revival, a soul-soaked, immersive tribute show celebrating the music and legacy of Amy Winehouse, which has quickly become a highlight of California‚Äôs live music and cabaret scene. 
Coco will be backed by LBZ and band. LaiddBackZach (LBZ), is a North Bay/Bay Area R&B, Hip-Hop, Funk, & Soul artist known for energetic shows with his band, often performing in Sonoma County venues like the Luther Burbank Center for the Arts, The California Theater, The Big Easy and breweries, blending songwriting with funk and soul grooves. You will also enjoy orginal pieces from LBZ and his band intermixed with Coco‚Äôs jazz covers for dazzling Burlesque performers. 
Tickets coming soon!

title: Mother's Day Self Care Retreat
location: Allume Med Spa,1301 Southpoint Boulevard, Petaluma, CA 94954, USA
description:
Overview

Celebrate Mother‚Äôs Day with a rejuvenating self-care experience‚Äîpamper, relax, and glow alongside the women you love.

Join us at Allume Med Spa for our Allume Facial Event, a Mother‚Äôs Day‚Äìinspired self-care experience designed to honor and celebrate moms, caregivers, and the special women in your life.

This event is the perfect opportunity to treat yourself‚Äîor bring your mother, daughter, sister, or friend‚Äîfor a shared day of relaxation, rejuvenation, and radiant skin. Spend quality time together while enjoying a series of indulgent treatments in a calm, spa-like environment.


Event Pricing:

  * $199 for two people
  * $119 for one person (single bookings must call to schedule)

Important scheduling note:
This is a timed experience. The event runs from 9:00 AM ‚Äì 3:00 PM, and each guest will select an individual treatment time within that window.
After purchasing your ticket, please call Allume Med Spa to reserve your preferred time slot.
Single-person bookings are scheduled by phone only.


Your Allume facial experience includes:

  * 30-Minute Glow Facial customized to refresh and illuminate your skin
  * LED Light Therapy to promote healing and enhance radiance
  * Chair Massage for deep relaxation
  * Lymphatic Drainage to reduce puffiness and support detoxification
  * Cervical Neck Care to release tension and improve circulation
  * Sound Bath Immersion for full-body relaxation
  * Essential Oil Aromatherapy to enhance your sensory experience
  * Paraffin Hand Treatment to deeply hydrate and soften skin
  * Spa Refreshments to enjoy while you unwind

Make this Mother‚Äôs Day special by gifting yourself‚Äîor a loved one‚Äîa restorative and luxurious self-care experience at Allume. Celebrate the women in your life with glowing skin, calm energy, and shared moments of wellness.

‚ú® Limited availability. Advance registration and phone scheduling required.

title: Salute to American Graffiti Car Show
location: Adobe Road Tasting Room, 6 Petaluma Blvd. N - Suite A1 Petaluma, CA
description:
Join us in downtown Petaluma for one of our most beloved hometown events ‚Äî Salute to American Graffiti Car Show & Cruisin‚Äô the Boulevard ! This annual celebration honors Petaluma‚Äôs role in George Lucas‚Äô iconic 1973 film American Graffiti and brings over 600 classic American cars back to the same streets where the movie was filmed. Walk the boulevard and enjoy the cars on display. The big cruise starts at 4:00 PM. This nostalgic event draws car lovers from all over to enjoy retro era cars and pop culture. While you‚Äôre visiting the event, stop by the Adobe Road Winery tasting room for a glass of wine ‚Äî we have front row seats to the action. See you in downtown Petaluma!

Source: Adobe Road Winery

title: Petaluma Art & Garden Festival
location: Historic Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
Petaluma Art & Garden Festival

The Art & Garden festival is one of Petaluma's most loved events! Join us Sunday, July 12, 2026 from 11 am to 5 pm for a fun filled day for all the family. Local crafters, artisans, gardeners, live music on two stages, and an array of local wineries, breweries, restaurants, and fine food purveyors will be participating.

The Art & Garden Festival will take place on Kentucky Street, Fourth Street, B Street, and A Street parking lot. Event Headquarters are at 20 4th Street, Petaluma.

This event is free to attend with Tasting Packages available to those who wish to partake in all the great wine, craft beer, cider, cocktails, and more.

Not the typical street fair, vendors are handpicked and will be showcasing quality, creative home and garden d√©cor, jewelry, arts, and more. With over 100 booths of unusual, unique, handmade items, this event has something for everyone‚Äôs taste and budget.

Experts will be on hand to answer gardening questions. Figure out how to grow vegetables in tricky Petaluma adobe soil and what makes a garden organic.

While parents are eating and dancing, kids can enjoy the children‚Äôs corner, with jumpy, face painting, FREE hands-on arts and crafts, and more!

Visit http://PetalumaDowntown.com for more information!

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Petaluma Downtown Sidewalk Sale
location: Downtown Petaluma
description:
The annual Petaluma Downtown Sidewalk Sale will take place Thursday, July 30 - Sunday, August 2, 2026.

Independent stores and restaurants are a vital part of the special character of Downtown Petaluma. The Sidewalk Sale is a perfect opportunity to do your part in keeping Petaluma retail alive and take home some great items at a fraction of the cost!

Join us for a stroll, grab a coffee, lunch, and enjoy a fun shopping experience at the Downtown Summer Sidewalk Sale!

Visit petalumadowntown.com https://petalumadowntown.com/petaluma-sidewalk-sale-marketplace for a list of participating merchants.

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Petaluma Fall Antique Faire
location: Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
Petaluma Fall Antique Faire

The much-anticipated Petaluma Fall Antique Faire returns on September 27, from 8am to 4pm, in Historic Downtown Petaluma. The Faire is located on Western Ave, the A Street Parking lot, and 4th & Kentucky Streets between B Street and Washington Street.

"The Bay Area's Premier Antique Center," Historic Downtown Petaluma will transform into an antique marketplace. Amid the beautiful historic buildings, one-of-a-kind stores, an incredible array of restaurants and cafes, guests can find an incomparable selection of affordable antiques from over 200 dealers. The show has a fantastic variety of estate jewelry, linens, furniture, art, kitchenware, vintage d√©cor, books, and all kinds of unusual collectibles to suit everyone's budget.

Antique and collectible lovers throughout the Bay Area are welcome to browse and shop the 40th Annual Petaluma Antique Faire set in our delightful and relaxing downtown Petaluma.

This show attracts over 8k discerning collectors as well as first-time buyers wishing to collect and invest in real antiques.

Visit http://petalumadowntown.com

~ Admission is free ~

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Halloween Trick or Treat Trail
location: Historic Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
A time of Bats and Broomsticks, Blood and Bugs - and of course, Downtown Petaluma‚Äôs Safe ‚ÄúTrick or Treat Trail‚Äù with the downtown Merchants!

Parents - gather your little ghosts, goblins, monsters, Harry Potters, witches on broomsticks, and princesses, and join the participating downtown merchants for the Annual Trick or Treat Trail this Halloween, Saturday, October 31 ~ from 3pm-5:30pm!


Download the Trick or Treat Trail Map for a list of participating locations on Kentucky St, 4th St, Western Ave, Petaluma Blvd, 2nd St, ‚ÄúC‚Äù St, Theater District, and the River Plaza Shopping Center. Participating businesses will be handing out Halloween goodies to costumed children!


Participating merchants will have signage placed outside their stores and noted on the map.
The Trick or Treat Trail Map will be available the week of the event on this page, or pick up from the Petaluma Visitors Center (hours on VisitPetaluma.com http://visitpetaluma.com/?fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTAAYnJpZBExYm5jemp6a0NVNXdIZVVvcXNydGMGYXBwX2lkEDIyMjAzOTE3ODgyMDA4OTIAAR62NbH49Ihdwn1mq8v-MEYPzzsJp6Mbhiq5j1uBL8LN1dv6W4go3YYW_aQDEg_aem_8XjO82vU_NWxm61vsZMATw ), or the Petaluma Museum (hours on PetalumaMuseum.com https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2FPetalumamuseum.com%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTAAYnJpZBExYm5jemp6a0NVNXdIZVVvcXNydGMGYXBwX2lkEDIyMjAzOTE3ODgyMDA4OTIAAR5rRw_VKmA8HgWfF15-55r1LAWKJjyppHXDw8FnuodV3lx_DIv_sGoYvXm63g_aem_YanWXmBxOVOyxu2VflCGYA&h=AT3gOBAV1m5L7i7ObKlMowMK_0bU3QtfjUmKEL0tB_3YFn5ZYKEwN02H1AQO-BpsJ-5_IJe2eZysw31Z9cxnLYXovLCAB_42OgyONq_8C8_rVI3F1ADdWMh3IYRSmtcg1Qr_BTRTDrCM76OX6xnJznujTrhaSQ&__tn__=q&c[0]=AT0vAvhWOgOakmE59n3NRL8J8WVsm0TrIrAOc-uH358SYfYFtptC4etqhBKXMoQ00ZuvgeJmpEdoU2-8oxoTiXRlLuUTzCWoO2k--QCDf9MjXfDt5e0rcbUAF6NJ56Mxpw6jdJrLViA7PNA-oO_PlgRrDVBLmJTA5Z0 ).

title: Santa's Riverboat Arrival & Small Business Saturday
location: River Plaza Shopping Center,54 E Washington St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
Santa's Riverboat Arrival

Saturday, November 28, 2026

11:30am - 1:30pm at River Plaza Shopping Center

Santa and Mrs. Claus are coming to town on November 28, the Saturday after Thanksgiving!

When Santa arrives in Petaluma, he leaves his sleigh at home. Instead, he and Mrs. Claus make a uniquely Petaluma arrival - they sail up the Petaluma River on a Lind Marine tugboat and dock at River Plaza Shopping Center on E. Washington to the cheers of excited children!

Starting at 11:30 am, families will enjoy live entertainment while waiting for Santa and Mrs. Claus to arrive! The Christmas couple will arrive around noon and will be welcomed by costumed dancers from the Petaluma School of Ballet‚Äôs ‚ÄúNutcracker.‚Äù Santa and Mrs. Claus will make their way across the parking lot to their festive tent outside Taps Restaurant where they will be available for family photos. Be sure to bring your Christmas wish list!

Santa would love to spend all afternoon in Petaluma, but in order to hear from all the good boys and girls all over the world, he will have to be on his way to his next destination at 1:30 pm.

Don‚Äôt let the fun stop there! Keep the festive mood flowing by taking your Shop Small swag bag and make the short walk to historic downtown Petaluma to support local shopping. When we all shop small, it's not just for the things we love, but for the businesses we love, for the community we call home, and to help promote local economic growth. Learn more about Small Business Saturday http://shopsmall.com/ and visit the official Small Business Saturday Facebook https://www.facebook.com/shopsmall/ page. And take advance of shop small benefits by using your American Express card by viewing this link here https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/maps?country=US&near=Petaluma,CA&cat=Shop-Small&cl=38.232417,-122.6366524&intlink=us-GABM-Shop_Small_Map .

Visit http://PetalumaDowntown.com for more information!

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Downtown Holiday Shopping Stroll
location: Downtown Petaluma
description:
Celebrate the season in Downtown Petaluma! Wander through festively decorated streets, discover one-of-a-kind gifts in local shops, and enjoy holiday treats, cheerful libations, live music, and extended store hours. All activities will take place inside participating businesses. Whether you‚Äôre hunting hens, shopping for loved ones, or simply soaking in the holiday spirit, there‚Äôs something fun on every corner.

Throughout the day you can enjoy photo ops with Santa & Mrs Claus, FREE Face painting, Dancers, singers, special holiday promotions & in-store activities, festive bites and drinks, live local music, holiday d√©cor & photo ops, Holiday Hen Hunt - details can be found HERE https://petalumadowntown.com/holiday-hen-hunt , and much more!

See the list of participating businesses offering special holiday activities and treats here https://petalumadowntown.com/holiday-shopping-stroll !

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Griffo Tasting Bar Open
description:
Stop in to our small-batch, craft distillery to sample our scientifically crafted spirits. Sip through a tasting flight or schedule a stroll across the production floor. Enjoy a menu of original craft cocktails from lounge seating in the Barrel Room.
